DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare effect two different protein supplement ( partially hydrolyze whey protein , PHWP vs. partially hydrolyze gelatin , PHG ) weight loss obse individual metabolic syndrome ( METS ) . These two supplement contain equal amount protein differ considerably amino acid content . Whey protein rich essential amino acid whereas gelatin rich proline . In obese individual METS , hypotheses : - PHWP augment fat-mass loss increase lean-mass fat-mass ration PHG . - PHWP improve insulin action PHG . - PHWP decrease cardiovascular disease risk PHG .
DOC.brief_title: CCRC : Effects Partially Hydrolyzed Whey Peptides ( PHWP ) On Weight Loss In Individuals With The Metabolic Syndrome ( METS )
DOC.detailed_description: The Metabolic Syndrome ( METS ) clinical disorder characterize follow problem : Obesity , especially locate waist area , elevate blood fat ( lipid ) , high blood pressure insulin resistance . The METS affect one third adult population USA increase risk diabetes harden artery , lead heart attack stroke . The best treatment improve symptom METS weight loss . In previous study , demonstrate whey protein ( WP ) supplementation increase weight loss especially fat-mass loss obese , insulin resistant woman compare carbohydrate . We propose compare WP another protein source patient METS weight loss . In addition , use special preparation call partially hydrolyze whey protein , may specific property increase fat mass loss .
DOC.criteria: Clinical Diagnoses Metabolic Syndrome ( least 3/5 follow ) Waist Circumference : men : > 40 woman : > 35 Blood Pressure : > 135/ > 85 mm Hg Triglycerides : > 150 mg/dl HDLcholesterol : men : < 40 mg/dl woman : < 50 mg/dl Fasting Glucose : > 100 mg/dl Ages 18 65 Years BMI range 27 42 kg/m^2 Body weight < 300 lbs Weight Stable 3 Months Subjects habitually consume protein supplement eat disorder Recent delivery ( within 12 month ) , lactation , pregnancy intention become pregnant Type 2 diabetes , kidney disease , liver disease , anemia , gout , cancer , untreated thyroid disease , gastrointestinal disease , metabolic disease malabsorption syndrome Triglyceride > 500 mg/dl , Cholesterol > 260 mg/dl Use insulin sensitizer , lipid lower medication ACE inhibitor Use antiobesity medication supplement lease 6 month prior start study Known allergy adverse reaction protein dairy product ( include lactose )
